title: 105_hr2992
content: The "Parents and Teachers Know Best Act of 1997" repeals the Goals 2000: Educate America Act and the National Skill Standards Act of 1994, allowing local educational areas to use funds for programs that meet their unique needs. The Secretary of Education reserves a small percentage of funds for outlying areas and Indian tribes. State educational agencies receive allotments from the remaining funds to carry out programs under the Act. Each State receives a portion of funds based on the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. 50 percent of the amount is allocated according to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. State educational agencies distribute funds to local educational agencies within the state. Each local educational agency in a State requesting a grant under this Act will receive an amount based on the school-age population of the area compared to the State's population. SEC. 5. USES OF FUNDS. Funds received under this Act can be used for technology, educational materials, and promising education reform projects such as effective schools and magnet schools. Programs to improve thinking skills, combat illiteracy, support gifted and talented children, and enhance school improvement efforts. SEC. 6. DEFINITIONS. The Act defines "Indian tribe" as any organized group eligible for special programs, "local educational agency" as defined in the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965, and "outlying areas" as specific territories. The curr_chunk defines terms such as "school-age population," "State," and "State educational agency" in relation to education. SEC. 7. Authorization of appropriations for this Act equal to previous Acts. SEC. 8. Effective date of this Act.
